recipe.title: Tea Icing

meta.comment: Tea is a wonderful variant of standard confectioner's icing. This recipe makes a strong tea infusion for flavour that will stand up to all the sugar. Earl Grey and green tea are good choices.

steps.step: Bring water to boil. Add tea leaves and infuse 5 minutes.
Strain the infusion from the leaves, squeezing as much from the leaves as possible.
Measure 30 g (2 tbs) of the infusion and combine with the remaining ingredients. Beat until smooth.
Correct thickness by adding more sugar or tea infusion if needed.

recipe.serving: Warm icing slightly over hot water to increase fluidity. Dip pastries into icing and let dry.
